column2: NEW MEXICO DMV TEST
column4: New Mexico
column6: NM

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. Drivers often fail to see a motorcycle headed toward them. Why?
column4: Motorcycles are hard to see.
column6: It is difficult to judge a motorcycle's speed.
column8: It is  hard to judge how far away a motorcycle is.

column2: 2. At intersections marked with stop lines, drivers must:
column4: slow down and enter the intersection.
column6: come to a complete stop.
column8: enter the intersection and then stop.

column2: 3. Always stop before you cross railroad tracks when:
column4: you are not wearing safety belts.
column6: you are following a bicyclist or motorcyclist across railroad tracks.
column8: you don't have room on the other side to completely cross the tracks.

column2: 4. Before turning, you should:
column4: sound your horn to alert the other drivers.
column6: change lanes.
column8: give the proper turn signal.

column2: 5. Alcohol:
column4: makes it difficult for drivers to judge their condition.
column6: makes drivers more prone to take chances.
column8: increases reaction time.

column2: 6. Which shape is a stop sign?
column4: Octagon
column6: Upside-down triangle
column8: Diamond

column2: 7. A driver should be extra alert for motorcyclists, bicycles and pedestrians. Why?
column4: They are hard to see in traffic.
column6: They always have the right-of-way.
column8: They don’t have rearview mirrors.

column2: 8. The following symptoms are associated with drowsy driving:
column4: You continue to yawn.
column6: You don’t remember driving the last few miles.
column8: Your eyes go out of focus by themselves.

column2: 9. If the entrance lane is too short to allow acceleration to expressway speed, you should:
column4: stop and wait for a large space in traffic.
column6: reduce your speed to 15 MPH or less and blend with traffic.
column8: enter the expressway and accelerate quickly.
column10: accelerate to expressway speed and blend with traffic.

column2: 10. While inside a roundabout, you should stay in your lane until you are ready to exit.
column4: True
column6: False

column2: 11. Give the right-of-way to any pedestrian:
column4: in a marked crosswalk.
column6: if you have the green light.
column8: on the opposite side of the street.

column2: 12. What should you do if your brakes fail?
column4: Hook your shoe under the pedal and see if you can free it.
column6: Try pumping the brake pedal to increase pressure.
column8: Turn on your cruise control.

column2: 13. One broken line indicates:
column4: You can not pass other vehicles or go across the line.
column6: You can change lanes, but only when traffic conditions or obstructions in the road make it necessary.
column8: You can pass other vehicles and change lanes, if it is safe.

column2: 14. Do not pass:
column4: when school bus lights are flashing.
column6: when approaching intersections.
column8: on hills or curves.

column2: 15. Motorists are not required to yield to pedestrians when approaching or exiting a roundabout.
column4: True
column6: False

column2: 16. When passing another car, you have enough room to return to the driving lane when:
column4: you have cleared the front bumper of the passed vehicle.
column6: you are at least 50 feet in front of the vehicle.
column8: you can see both headlights of the car you passed in your rearview mirror.
column10: you cannot see the vehicle directly to your right.

column2: 17. When entering a freeway, you should check traffic by:
column4: using both the inside and outside mirrors.
column6: using the inside mirror.
column8: using the side mirror and looking over your shoulder.

column2: 18. Parking is not allowed:
column4: on the road side of a parked vehicle.
column6: in a crosswalk.
column8: in a tunnel.

column2: 19. The first thing affected after drinking alcohol is:
column4: judgment.
column6: speech.
column8: vision.

column2: 20. A red arrow on a traffic light means:
column4: You must stop and then proceed when the way is clear.
column6: You may turn in in the direction of the arrow after coming to a complete stop.
column8: You may not turn in the direction of the arrow until a green light or arrow light goes on.

column2: 21. If you miss your exit from an interstate expressway, you should:
column4: make a quick U-turn from your lane of travel.
column6: pull over to the right and back up with caution until you reach the exit ramp.
column8: go to the next exit and come back to the exit you missed.
column10: use the right turn signal, check your mirrors and move to the right.

column2: 22. To safely cross a railroad, drivers should:
column4: listen and look both ways, then proceed if it is safe to do so.
column6: look both ways only if the red light is flashing.
column8: drive across quickly if a train is approaching, or if it is too close, stop and then back up.
column10: stop within 10 feet of all railroad crossings.

column2: 23. When parking on a public road, drivers should:
column4: move as far away from traffic as possible.
column6: always park on the left side of the roadway.
column8: pull as far away from the roadside shoulder as possible.

column2: 24. When drivers see the ‘Wrong Way’ sign:
column4: they are going the wrong way on an expressway exit ramp.
column6: they must not leave the pavement except in an emergency.
column8: they must stop immediately.
column10: they must drive past this sign and reach the next intersection.

column2: 25. As you enter a roundabout you should slow down and:
column4: yield to any vehicle coming from your left in the roundabout.
column6: yield to pedestrians and bicyclist crossing before entering the roundabout.
column8: All of the above.
